Judul: CUTOFF FREQUENCY UTILIZATION IN FEEDBACK  ERROR NUMERICAL INTEGRATION FOR DC MOTOR  CONTROLLER
Abstrak:
Actuator control for industrial and research purposes are always associated with PID 
controllers to ensure that input targets are fulfilled. Most of these controllers inevitably 
require numerical methods for integration and/or differentiation, and could potentially 
amplify numerical errors. However, only a few researchers investigate these errors’ 
effects. Therefore, this research is dedicated to minimize these numerical errors utilizing 
the cutoff frequency for feedback error numerical integration from a PI controller. 
This research is conducted in three main steps: model simulation, Autodesk design, 
and experiment setup. The model simulation aims to estimate optimal PI constants for 
later use by modelling a DC motor. The Autodesk design functions to synergize hardware 
models and code. The experiment setup is the phase where hardware was assembled and 
operated. After all these three steps were orderly done, the research resulted in a controller 
incorporating the cutoff frequency for feedback error numerical integration. This 
controller’s performance will be compared to another controller which utilizes a 
trapezoidal integration method based on their control responses. 
The experiment results show that when compared to the controller with trapezoidal 
integration, the controller utilizing the cutoff frequency integration produces a control 
response with higher overshoot and gain. The controller with cutoff frequency also 
resulted in a faster time constant, rise time, and settling time. Lastly, the controller with 
cutoff frequency outputs speed readings with lower speed root mean square error 
(deviation).
Kata Kunci: PID controller, numerical errors, cutoff frequency, control response
